node.statement: (Absorption of the divergent linear term) The divergent linear term L_eps = 2 delta_m_eps^2 <psi, phi> acts as an exponential tilt of the measure. Under mu_eps (and in the limit mu), the linear functional <psi, phi> has sub-Gaussian tails with constants uniform in eps. Therefore E_{mu_eps}[exp(L_eps)] = E_{mu_eps}[exp(2 delta_m_eps^2 <psi, phi>)] is finite for each eps (though growing). The normalization constant -log E_{mu_eps}[exp(Psi_eps^{ren} + L_eps)] absorbs this growth. The key point: the normalized quantity R_eps is a ratio that remains bounded in L^p(mu) for suitable p, even as individual terms diverge.
